Data Analytics on Black Friday

This document excerpt discusses the application of data analytics to business problems, specifically using R programming and machine learning techniques. It provides an example of how a classification tree algorithm arrives at rules to assign labels based on features such as occupation and relationship. The goal is to minimize impurity in the data by splitting it into the largest collections of purest labels possible.

Key Concepts:

  • Classification Trees
  • Impurity
  • Decision Making with Classification Trees
data analytics R programming machine learning classification trees
